subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Surveillance and Religious Freedom
description: A 60-second lesson on Surveillance and Religious Freedom.

hook.text: China uses facial recognition to track Uyghur Muslims into mosques. Safety tech becomes a tool of oppression.

buildup.text: Governments can now monitor religious gatherings, track donations, and flag 'extreme' beliefs with digital tools.

discovery.text: Even democracies debate it. Should authorities monitor radical mosques? Radical churches? Who decides 'radical'?

twist.text: The same tech that enables online worship enables online surveillance. Freedom and control use the same infrastructure.

climax.text: Religious freedom in a digital age needs new protections. Old laws weren't written for a world where prayer is tracked.

punchline.text: Technology tracks prayer now. Religious freedom needs digital protection.

quiz.question: How does technology threaten religious freedom?
options: Governments use surveillance to monitor religious gatherings, beliefs, and donations
